Doc: A type defining parameters associated with a floating rate reset. This type forms part of the cashflows representation of a stream.

Source.Contents:
/#
   A type defining parameters associated with a floating rate reset. This type forms part of the cashflows representation of a stream.
 #/
record FpML5.confirmation.FloatingRateDefinition {
  # The final calculated rate for a calculation period after any required averaging of rates A calculated rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
  calculatedRate : decimal?

  # The details of a particular rate observation, including the fixing date and observed rate. A list of rate observation elements may be ordered in the document by ascending adjusted fixing date. An FpML document containing an unordered list of rate observations is still regarded as a conformant document.
  rateObservation : FpML5.confirmation.RateObservation?

  # A rate multiplier to apply to the floating rate. The multiplier can be a positive or negative decimal. This element should only be included if the multiplier is not equal to 1 (one).
  floatingRateMultiplier : decimal?

  # The ISDA Spread, if any, which applies for the calculation period. The spread is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. For purposes of determining a calculation period amount, if positive the spread will be added to the floating rate and if negative the spread will be subtracted from the floating rate. A positive 10 basis point (0.1%) spread would be represented as 0.001.
  spread : decimal?

  # The cap rate, if any, which applies to the floating rate for the calculation period. The cap rate (strike) is only required where the floating rate on a swap stream is capped at a certain strike level. The cap rate is assumed to be exclusive of any spread and is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. A cap rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
  capRate : FpML5.confirmation.Strike?

  # The floor rate, if any, which applies to the floating rate for the calculation period. The floor rate (strike) is only required where the floating rate on a swap stream is floored at a certain strike level. The floor rate is assumed to be exclusive of any spread and is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. The floor rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
  floorRate : FpML5.confirmation.Strike?

}

calculatedRate.Doc: The final calculated rate for a calculation period after any required averaging of rates A calculated rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
calculatedRate.Name: calculatedRate

rateObservation.Doc: The details of a particular rate observation, including the fixing date and observed rate. A list of rate observation elements may be ordered in the document by ascending adjusted fixing date. An FpML document containing an unordered list of rate observations is still regarded as a conformant document.
rateObservation.Name: rateObservation

floatingRateMultiplier.Doc: A rate multiplier to apply to the floating rate. The multiplier can be a positive or negative decimal. This element should only be included if the multiplier is not equal to 1 (one).
floatingRateMultiplier.Name: floatingRateMultiplier

spread.Doc: The ISDA Spread, if any, which applies for the calculation period. The spread is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. For purposes of determining a calculation period amount, if positive the spread will be added to the floating rate and if negative the spread will be subtracted from the floating rate. A positive 10 basis point (0.1%) spread would be represented as 0.001.
spread.Name: spread

capRate.Doc: The cap rate, if any, which applies to the floating rate for the calculation period. The cap rate (strike) is only required where the floating rate on a swap stream is capped at a certain strike level. The cap rate is assumed to be exclusive of any spread and is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. A cap rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
capRate.Name: capRate

floorRate.Doc: The floor rate, if any, which applies to the floating rate for the calculation period. The floor rate (strike) is only required where the floating rate on a swap stream is floored at a certain strike level. The floor rate is assumed to be exclusive of any spread and is a per annum rate, expressed as a decimal. The floor rate of 5% would be represented as 0.05.
floorRate.Name: floorRate
